channel.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
channel.description:
I can't sleep, I just threw up because of stress, my heart feels like its got heavier and I can't concentrate.
I have 4 deadlines for the 16th and its making it so much worse because I do some work, go back look over it and think its not up-to standards and start again, adding to the stress.
halppp?

item.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:

[quote=“Ollie, post:9, topic:424550”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=527206.msg3844623#msg3844623 date=1323535641]

[/quote]

and a byte code library :|[/quote]That’s what I was referring to LoL

item.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

Aah I fucking hate that type of stress. What I do to try to cope is tell myself that I’m doing the best I can and worrying about it while I try to sleep will only make things worse so I try to focus on something else. When you are sleeping, you aren’t working so there is no point in stressing out about it.

Read full topic
item.source: Stress, why is it so powerful?

item.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:4, topic:424550”]Stress is powerful because it has real biological impact on your body. When under stress, your parasympathetic nervous system retreats a bit and the sympathetic steps up. This results in so many changes, epinephrine gets dumped through you making your heart beat faster etc., cortisol shows up and fucks with your blood sugar and immune system… basically, its a state we were intended to live in for short bursts to help us react to some stressor, not stay in for long periods of time… we just weren’t designed that way. It’s like running at the red line for 24 hours a day.

As someone who runs at the red line for 24 hours a day, I sympathise. Anxiety blows.[/quote]
Hyundai bungs (some of) their brand new engines up to red line for 7 days non stop to test them.

Read full topic
item.source: Stress, why is it so powerful?

item.source: Stress, why is it so powerful?

item.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Stress is powerful because it has real biological impact on your body. When under stress, your parasympathetic nervous system retreats a bit and the sympathetic steps up. This results in so many changes, epinephrine gets dumped through you making your heart beat faster etc., cortisol shows up and fucks with your blood sugar and immune system… basically, its a state we were intended to live in for short bursts to help us react to some stressor, not stay in for long periods of time… we just weren’t designed that way. It’s like running at the red line for 24 hours a day.

As someone who runs at the red line for 24 hours a day, I sympathise. Anxiety blows.

Read full topic
item.source: Stress, why is it so powerful?

item.title: Stress, why is it so powerful?
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

Bowser jr:

You should complete everything first, and then caring about the quality. Some work is better than nothing at all.

this then refine and add to your work if you have time
even if it’s a basic outline in an essay you can bulk it out after and clarify points

and if possible you could try for defferals? they will probably wan some good excuses but alot of people are more compassionate than you may first expect

Read full topic
